name: SupportMoulderAndVanessa
_source: speak;Moulder;Vanessa, how are you holding up?
speak;Vanessa;Father Moulder.|We are struggling, but I'll pull through somehow.|Say, Father Moulder...
speak;Moulder;You want to know about Prince Innes, don't you?|He's doing well.|I was worried for a moment, but he'll be fine.
speak;Moulder;|Well...|You see, as a priest, I've met people from all walks of life.|Some of them-like you-well, I can read them like an open book.
speak;Moulder;No, no.|It's not like that.|I just mean you are a pure, straightforward girl.|That's a compliment worthy of a knight.
speak;Vanessa;Do you think so?|Thank you, Father.
speak;Moulder;Hm.|Say, would you like to hear a story from the prince's youth?
speak;Moulder;Hm...|Oh my!|You know, I think we'd better take care of our enemies, first.
speak;Vanessa;Look out!|Over there!|Stay here, Father.|I'll take care of this.
speak;Moulder;|Yes, I think that would be best.
speak;Vanessa;Tell me your story another time, though.|I'd like to hear it.
speak;Moulder;Well, do you have time for that story I promised?
speak;Moulder;It was over ten years ago, when the prince was just a child.|There was a ceremony at the castle, with a trick archer of sorts.

speak;Moulder;Yes.|He was a very famous and undeniably skilled archer from abroad.|He was to shoot a tiny target that had been placed in the distance.|However, in the middle of the show, someone stopped him from shooting.
speak;Moulder;Yes, it was young Prince Innes.|He said, “That's not far enough!|Move the target back farther!”|Then, he insisted on trying himself.
speak;Moulder; Isn't it?|King Hayden tried to stop him, but...|Well, you know how he is.|He doesn't listen to anyone.|And so, it became a contest between our prince and this foreign archer.

speak;Moulder;First, they established the ground rules.|Each person was to shoot at the target.|If both arrows hit, they increased the range.|They simply continued to move the target back until one person missed the mark.

speak;Moulder;Ah, but the two were evenly matched.|Every shot was a perfect bull's-eye.|The crowd cheered, and the target moved ever farther back...|But then it came to the turning point.|The foreign archer said, “This is no test. Let's move the target back more.”|It seemed like bravado, but the archer actually had a clever tactic in mind.

speak;Moulder;They had been shooting for some time, and the archer's arms had grown weary.|Precision archery is far more taxing than the battlefield, you see.|So even though he was a skilled archer, he was at the limits of his endurance.|He was still hitting the mark accurately, but his arm was quivering more and more.|Everyone knew that the prince was on the verge of victory.
speak;Vanessa;I don't understand.|They were shooting at the same target, shot for shot, right?|Why would moving the target make any difference?

speak;Moulder;Yes, they were still shooting at the same target.|However, the archer suggested that they move the target much farther away...|Much farther than any child Innes's age could hope to loose an arrow to.
speak;Moulder;Even the archer, with his trained arms, was firing at his maximum range.|In fact, he almost missed the target!|Then, it was the prince's turn.

speak;Moulder;It was clearly too far away for the young prince to hit the target.|But His Highness was undeterred.|He drew his string and fired up into the sky.|The arrow did not merely hit the target.|No, it was a perfect bull's-eye!|You see, the prince arced his shot to extend his range beyond its limits.|To hit a target this way requires incredible skill, but the prince did it.|And then he turned to the archer and said, “Shall we move the target back farther?”|The archer looked so crestfallen.|He admitted defeat, and it was settled.
speak;Vanessa;Thank you very much, Father Moulder!|That's incredible!|I'm even more-
speak;Moulder;I'm glad you liked the story.|Keep up the good work, Vanessa.
speak;Moulder;I'm glad to see you well, Vanessa.|You do your fellow pegasus knights proud.|We are blessed to have you fighting at our side.
speak;Vanessa;You credit us warriors too much, Father.|Without healers, we would all be lost.|Nothing I say can tell you how much I value your presence here.
speak;Moulder;We are all doing our part in this war.|No need to thank me.
speak;Vanessa;I'm serious!|Without your help, we would never survive these skirmishes!
speak;Vanessa;Father...|Thank you again for the other day.
speak;Moulder;Ah...|You know, you remind me of myself, twenty years back.
speak;Moulder;Good luck to you, Vanessa.|I don't know where this will lead, but I'm sure the prince knows your feelings.
speak;Vanessa;Father Moulder, I only aspire to be worthy of his greatness.|I expect nothing in return.

speak;Moulder;Well, do what you think is best for you.|We all carry many burdens...|To country, family, duty, honor...|However, we are all ultimately free to embrace or reject those burdens.|If you find yourself in need of spiritual guidance, speak to me.
speak;Vanessa;Father Moulder, you're so kind.|Thank you.|I'm so grateful to have you on the field with me.
speak;Moulder;Vanessa, we fight for the greater good.|We fight for our country, for our friends, and...for ourselves.
speak;Vanessa;You're right, Father.|In so many things.
